class.name: LuaAPI
class.brief_description: Execute Lua code at runtime and make your own API.
class.description: This class represents a lua state and allows you to interact with lua at runtime. You can load files and strings code. Push Callable's as lua functions. And push any Variant as a lua variable.

method.name: new_coroutine
method.description: This method will create a coroutine that is already bound to this runtime.

method.name: get_running_coroutine
method.description: Intended to be called from a lua hook. Returns the current running coroutine.

method.name: bind_libraries
method.description: Bind lua libraries to the LuaAPI Object. Returns an error if a library fails to bind. Note: in C#, the param Array must be a [code]Godot.Collections.Array[/code] and not a [code]System.Array[/code] class.

method.name: do_file
method.description: Loads a file with luaL_loadfile() passing its absolute path. Similar to [code].DoString()[/code], this function loads a lua file into the LuaAPI Object and executes it as Lua. [code]FilePath[/code] must be an absolute path, and must exist or an error is reutrned.

method.name: do_string
method.description: Loads a string with luaL_loadstring() and executes the top of the stack. Returns any errors. Use [code].DoString()[/code] to execute a lua script or snippet stored within a string variable or a string literal.

method.name: function_exists
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] only if [code]LuaFunctionName[/code] is defined in the global environment table as a function.

method.name: call_function
method.description: Calls a function inside current Lua state. This can be either a exposed function or a function defined with with Lua. You may want to check if the function actually exists with [code]function_exists(LuaFunctionName)[/code]. This function supports 1 return value from lua. It will be returned as a variant and if Lua returns no value it will be null. If an error occurs while calling this function, a LuaError object will be returned.

method.name: pull_variant
method.description: Will pull a copy of a global Variant from lua.

method.name: push_variant
method.description: Will push a copy of a Variant to lua as a global. Returns a error if the type is not supported. Using [code].PushVariant[/code] in C# to push a function requires wrapping the Method in a [code]Callable[/code] first. In GDScript the wrapper is not needed.

method.name: get_registry_value
method.description: Will pull a copy of a Variant from lua's registry table.

method.name: set_registry_value
method.description: Will push a copy of a Variant to lua's registry table. Returns a error if the type is not supported.

method.name: set_hook
method.description: Sets the hook for the state. The hook will be called on the events specified by the mask. The count specifies how many instructions should be executed before the hook is called. If count is 0, the hook will be called on every instruction. The hook will be called with the following arguments: [code]hook(parent, event, line)[/code]. The parent is the LuaAPI object that owns the current state.

method.name: configure_gc
method.description: Controls the garbage collector. The option can be one of the following: [code]GC_STOP[/code], [code]GC_RESTART[/code], [code]GC_COLLECT[/code], [code]GC_COUNT[/code], [code]GC_STEP[/code], [code]GC_SETPAUSE[/code], [code]GC_SETSTEPMUL[/code]. The data is the argument for the option. Returns the result of the option.

method.name: get_memory_usage
method.description: Returns the current memory usage of the state in bytes.

members.member: This is the default LuaMetatable to use for object which do not define a lua_metatable field. By default it is a LuaDefaultObjectMetatable. You can change this to a custom metatable to change the behavior of all objects.
Sets the memory limit for the state in bytes. If the limit is 0, there is no limit.

When true, Lua functions passed to Godot will use the LuaCallable type. This type is a CallableCustom which has issues currently with GDExtension and C# When false, Lua functions passed to Godot will use the LuaFunctionRef type. This type is a RefCounted which behaves the same as a LuaCallable. But uses Inoke instead of Call.
